attributes.action: Increased enforcement and penalties for littering and advertising campaign
attributes.background: There has been a large increase of street waste due to the inconsiderate minority not picking up dog waste and discarding their face coverings and gloves.  Harsher penalties which are more strictly enforced are needed.  Increase the penalties and recruit more wardens to police and enforce them.
attributes.additional_details: The conscientious majority are making absolutely no headway against the inconsiderate and filthy minority who discard picnic leftovers, drink bottles and cans, disposable face masks and gloves, don't pick up after their dogs, unwrap, drop wrapper and eat when they leave a shop and many more.  This shows zero consideration for other people, livestock, wildlife or the environment. The Government must  take this seriously and bring in harsher penalties, then recruit more people to enforce them.

rejection.details:
Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.action: Allow hair salons to re open before July with the correct measures in place
attributes.background: Re evaluate the decision to allow hair Salons to re open earlier than July.A lot of business have returned to normal, and we feel it is very unfair we are being made to wait until July. This could have a catastrophic effect on our industry. We are not in the same bracket as a pub or cinema.
attributes.additional_details: We as an industry have seen many more business re open around us that we now see as Unfair,if we cannot our selfs operate until at least July. There are many safe reasons we can return to work providing a safe environment for our clients in a one in one out type of appointment only basis. Wearing the correct ppe. To compare hair salons to a pub or cinema, you can not operate these business on a small proportion but we certainly can. We feel victimised and it’s unjust and we feel we should be allowed to open sooner. Closing for three months or more could have and already has seen salons shut there doors and will not be able to re open. This is such a sad time for our industry and we feel it needs revised for June time, given the amount of other business that have re opened.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319313

attributes.action: Extra hours worked by Health workers out of their contract hours to be tax free
attributes.background: We will appreciate if you put our views and concerns forward to the parliament on our behalf so that any overtime hours done above the normal directive hours (37.5hrs) to be tax free during this period (COVID-19)
attributes.additional_details: In the light of COVID-19 global crises. Health professionals are committed to go extra miles to ensure NHS have the extra capacity to continue to provide care to patients in a safe environment. However, staff and other retired healthcare workers persuaded to work are worried on the tax implication this would have on their income. The next couple of months will be extremely challenging for all NHS services with regards to current staffing level and this is anticipated

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting the salary of most key workers, or setting minimum wages for particular sectors, but you may wish to sign petitions calling for the following actions:

Make hazard pay mandatory for key workers in the midst of COVID 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307619

Give all key workers a 100% tax and Nat. Ins. holiday through COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306845

Pay bonus to all key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Bonus for emergency services personnel working due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303306

Make the minimum wage equal for all ages and increase to at least £10: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301749

attributes.action: Ensure council do not cut bin collection during Corona virus emergency.
attributes.background: I want parliament to force all local councils to not cur bin collections during coronavirus emergency or force them to issue 50% council tax refund if they do.
attributes.additional_details: Bromley council just announced they will not collect plastics or paper bins during the outbrake. Bin man were classed as key workers so why is council doing that? It will help spread bacteria and will have impact on environment. Especially that they also closed local recycling plants.

rejection.details:
Waste management is devolved, so it is up to individual local authorities how to manage this, not the Government or Parliament.

You could submit a petition on this issue directly to Bromley Council. Details of how to do this are available here: https://cds.bromley.gov.uk/mggeneric.aspx?md=petitions&bcr=1

attributes.action: All NHS staff free to wear an FFP3 mask for protection against COVID-19.
attributes.background: The only way we have to protect ourselves is by wearing a mask AT ALL TIMES, not just with confirmed cases of COVID-19, but with any patient and in any clinical environment from immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
To protect the life of all the NHS workers and indirectly all the UK population. If NHS workers can protect themselves they can still work for their patients'health.
Make sure that all NHS staff does not run any additional risk related to their health, being at work has to be safe at all times, even when there is only a little risk to be infected all the precautions need to be taken.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304243

attributes.action: Pay our student nurses a wage during the COVID-19 crisis
attributes.background: Many of our student nurses are out working in placements on the front line in the midst of the Coronavirus pandemic. These men and women are putting their lives and the lives of their families at risk and should be paid a living wage.
attributes.additional_details: Pay our future nurses a living wage. Although, people go into the healthcare industry to help others, they should not be expected to work in this extremely high risk environment for free. They have rent and bills like everyone else and families to feed. We need to do more to support them while they do their part during this time of crisis.

rejection.details:
Student placements are a matter for the educational institutions the student is enrolled in, the organisation sponsoring the placement, and the regulatory bodies that are responsible for the qualifications, not the Government or Parliament.

If you have concerns about continuing with a placement you should raise these with the educational institution you are enrolled in, the organisation sponsoring your placement, and the relevant regulatory body.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: I would like the government to ban the sale of peanuts on trains
attributes.background: Bags of peanuts are one of the only food items sold on train carriages on trolleys that can cause serious reactions, given their tendency to leave crumbs and for traces to become airborne easily. This is important because many people in the UK suffer from life-threatening food allergies to peanuts.
attributes.additional_details: By not offering peanuts on trains, the environment can be made much safer for those travelling with severe and life-threatening allergies, as people will not be tempted to buy peanuts simply because they are on offer. As a peanut allergy sufferer myself, I would love to be able to commute between university and home - and work in the future - and not have this become an unnecessarily stressful experience just because of the sale of one item of food.

attributes.action: To make disposable vapes more recyclable with removable, rechargeable batteries!
attributes.background: Lithium batteries contain precious resources which are toxic to our water supplies, ecosystems, as well as an immediate fire risk! These can and have been recycled for many years! A petition could lead to legislation to force the vaping industry to stop the sales of single use vapes!
attributes.additional_details:
To encourage and work with vaping organisations/vendors to establish recycling schemes all over the UK! We need to encourage people to stop smoking tobacco and recycle at the same time! But as it is, it's at a great cost to our environment and growing with many people opting for the single-use/ disposable vape setup! Maybe a recycling cash-back scheme could be introduced!

The harmful impact it has on our environment is a massive growing concern that is not going away!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for manufacturers.

We could accept a petition calling for a ban on single-use e-cigarettes, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Stop any plans to extend the MOT test frequency
attributes.background: We would like the government to commit to not extending the MOT test frequency. Any extension would be a dangerous step backwards for road safety and ultimately cost hard-pressed motorists more money. Vehicle emissions remaining unchecked will also potentially harm the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has the safest roads in Europe. To ensure motoring is as safe and cost-effective as possible, motorists must have their vehicle inspected and serviced regularly.

Data from the DVSA shows that one in three vehicles presented for an MOT test fail and 30 percent of those fail on brakes, a safety critical component. 

Moving to an extended testing period with an ageing vehicle parc would see more defective vehicles on UK roads and potentially cause more accidents and fatalities, as well as higher repair costs.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Keep MOT tests as a yearly requirement
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/615690

attributes.action: Ensure all high street retailers offer customers an email copy of their receipts
attributes.background: Enact a rule so that all high street retailers are required to offer customers the ability to have their receipts emailed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
Most retailers do not offer to replace or return an item if the customer cannot show a receipt of purchase. Maintaining a bunch of such receipts creates unnecessary pressure on the customer. Moreover being printed on paper they are not exactly environment friendly. 
Hence, I seek to ask the government to make it mandatory for all high street retailers to offer customers the ability to email them their receipts.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for retailers.

attributes.action: For all crisp packets to be recyclable
attributes.background: I believe that as 11 billion packets of crisps are consumed each year that we should be able to enjoy them whilst also protecting out environment.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for crisp producers.

attributes.action: Don’t ban people without GCSE Maths & English from accessing student loans
attributes.background: It is essential that everybody has the chance to go to university. Some people don’t get these GCSEs because of the school they go to which might be in a poorer area. It is completely unfair to block them from making the leap to higher education just because of where they live.
attributes.additional_details: My mother doesn’t have GCSE maths. She’s an incredible English tutor & has taught English, Media & drama in schools. She would never have been able to help all these people if she hadn’t gone to uni (without a student loan it would have been impossible). These tests don’t always test actual intelligence. Students must tick boxes and some of the brightest individuals struggle. That doesn’t mean they don’t deserve access to higher education in an environment that might suit them better.

rejection.details:
We understand that you would like to see changes in the way that student finance is distributed but we're not sure what action you would like the Government to take. Maths and English GCSE are not currently conditions for securing a student loan or finance, it is a condition of being accepted onto a degree, or other higher education course.

You could start a new petition calling for Maths and English GCSE to no longer be mandatory for being accepted on to a higher education course, if this is something you would like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make school uniforms more environmentally friendly by removing logo on them .
attributes.background: Stop schools from  putting logos on uniforms and help the environment so they can be reused , worn outside school, passed on, donated .Over 8million children we’re registered for schools last year , 8million uniforms! .They are quality items that they grow out of before wearing out .
attributes.additional_details: My son recently started senior school with new uniforms. Blazer, tracksuit top, track bottoms, shorts, PE shirt , and PE top all emblazoned with the school logo. He  will wear his PE equipment 60 lessons in the academic year . This will not fit him next year .Secondary schools don’t have preloved sales and we have nobody to pass it on to . I’ve still have t shirts and sweatshirts from his previous schools. Make them more environmentally friendly so they can be passed on and worn outside school

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to include a school logo on uniforms are a matter for individual schools, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Don't sell out COP26 by lettings companies like NatWest sponsor it
attributes.background: If the government is serious about making changes to society to save the environment they shouldn't allow companies like NatWest, who invest in fossil fuels, clean up their image and sponsor COP26 without a complete commitment to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
NatWest score 0/20 on www.ethicalconsumer.org on the environment. This is because they fund fossil fuels. Even their own attempt to look green says they will:
"At least halve the climate impact of our financing activity by 2030 and intend to do what is necessary to achieve alignment with the 2015 Paris agreement."

Which means a bare minimum of change not a complete commitment to change. It means they will continue to fund companies that are contributing to climate change for a further 9 years.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about sponsorship of COP26, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do.

Your petition says the Government should not allow companies to sponsor COP26 without "a complete commitment to the environment", but it's not clear what this would mean in practice.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to end sponsorship deals with companies that do not meet certain requirements, but it would need to be clear what you wanted these requirements to be.

attributes.action: Put notices in male toilets at venues: how to protect women from sexual violence
attributes.background: Put notices in men's toilets in bars, clubs and restaurants on how to protect women against sexual assault, spiking and rape. This signage will ask men to look out for women in these spaces, to recognise signs that a woman is uncomfortable, and to call out fellow men on sexist behaviours and speech.
attributes.additional_details: #AskForAngela is in women's toilets and men have no equivalent, this places the responsibility on women to protect themselves against sexual violence. The issue of gender based violence needs to be recognised and understood as a men's issue alone. Ensuring men use their power to safeguard women in these environments will create a shared sense of responsibility, and act as a deterrent against predatory behaviour. This will help change the cultural rhetoric from 'Don't be raped' to 'Don't rape.'

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a decision for venues.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to fund an awareness campaign targeted at men, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Influence the Faroe Islands Government to ban the killing of whales and dolphins
attributes.background:
UK Government to work internationally to pressure the Faroe Islands Government to ban the killing of whales and dolphins.

Use diplomatic means to make it clear we oppose this practice and apply pressure to the Faroe Islands government to consider that not all traditions fit in the modern world.
attributes.additional_details: The recent cull of 1428 white sided dolphins represents a loss of about 1 in every 150 of this species globally, a huge impact. The practice demonstrates a complete disregard for nature which is linked to behaviours that threaten our long term existence. By not actively opposing this, other efforts to protect the environment made by businesses and individuals feel futile by comparison. The continued practice also may legitimise other’s negative behaviours toward our environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597171

attributes.action: Introduce coastal safety into the curriculum at all age levels.
attributes.background:
We are an island nation. The seas and their perils surround us, yet the majority wouldn’t even know what a rip tide was, let alone how to identify one. 
Coastal safety and marine awareness should be part of the curriculum for all age groups.
attributes.additional_details:
How many adults in the U.K. could tell you the difference between a spring and neap tide? How many could tell you what flood and ebb mean? How many could identify a rip tide and other dangerous warning signs around our coast? 
As an island nation, these factors are as critical as learning how to cross a road. 
It’s not just a matter of safety, but a step towards learning to appreciate, respect and care for the marine environment that surrounds us all.

rejection.details: The national curriculum for physical education already requires schools to provide swimming instruction in key stage 1 or key stage 2, including how to swim competently, confidently and proficiently, and how to perform safe self-rescue in different water-based situations: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-physical-education-programmes-of-study/national-curriculum-in-england-physical-education-programmes-of-study#swimming-and-water-safety

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay & Maternity Allowance to full time living wage
attributes.background: Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is at £151. 20 a week, which is not enough to meet the cost of life in the UK , especially not london let alone the added cost of a baby. This financial vulnerability puts mothers and children at risk of abuse amd illness.
attributes.additional_details:
The early years are a vulnerable time when children’s experiences and environments can negatively influence their development. 

Growing up in poverty has a long lasting impact on children's development, school attainment and health. Children in more deprived areas are more likely to face a serious illness during childhood and to have a long-term disability. The current SMP puts an added strain on families and leaves single mothers in disasterous situations.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want Statutory Maternity Pay and Maternity Allowance to be increased, but we're not sure how much you want it to be increased by, as there is no set definition of a full-time living wage. The Government sets national minimum wages, but these only apply to hourly wages.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Enhance maternity leave to be at full pay for 6 months: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573965

Increase Maternity/Shared Parental pay in line with National Living Wage: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583847

attributes.action: Stop pest control companies using poison bait stations
attributes.background: I want the government or parliament to ban poison bait stations and make pest control companies  use non lethal methods. That won't affect other wildlife animals. Cats and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Using poison bait stations is disgusting.and cruel. Which  causes unnecessary suffering.When rats and mice. eat it they go off and die. A fox or cat maybe a bird of prey will pick up the dead rodent.and get poisoned too leading to death.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about poison bait stations, but we're not sure if you just want pest control companies to be banned from using these stations, or for their use to be banned entirely. We're also not sure if you want only this type of lethal pest control method to be banned, as your petition refers to requiring pest control companies to use non-lethal methods instead.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from environmentally-friendly products
attributes.background: Many green products products are relatively new to the market and so cost effective manufacturing processes are not yet available, and so some of this cost is passed on to consumers. In addition, these products are sold in smaller volumes because people are reluctant to switch to a green alternative
attributes.additional_details:
Price is at the forefront of any consumer's mind when selecting a product. Environmentally friendly products are often more expensive that the 'regular' equivalent. Consumers are therefore required to pay extra for the benefit of the environment. 
Removing VAT from environmentally friendly products would reduce the price difference between 'regular' products and their environmentally friendly alternatives. This would encourage consumers to switch to the environmentally friendly product.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the environment, but it's not clear what you mean by "environmentally-friendly products".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling for products that are recyclable, or certified as being carbon neutral, to be exempted from VAT.

attributes.action: Compensate University Students for lost social and academic development.
attributes.background: The government must debate the plight of over 2 million students across all universities who have continued to pay for accommodation and face to face learning, from 23 March 2020, whilst being encouraged to move home, adhere to lockdown rules and work in an Open University environment.
attributes.additional_details: Please compensate students for the lost opportunity for a full education.  Keeping libraries open to maintain an illusion of an 'open facility' but shutting lecture theatres, does not constitute a university education.  With practical lessons cancelled and practical assessments replaced with essays, we have huge gaps in student's education.  The effect on student mental health arising from the lockdown, unable to take part in societies, sport and social events, is yet unknown.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Require universities to fully refund tuition fees for the Autumn term: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555583

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814

Refund ALL University student tuition fees due to lack of quality in education: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555516

Reduce student loan debts by the cost of all tuition fees paid during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560953

attributes.action: Maintain the UK ban on bee-harming pesticides and use of Neonicotinoids
attributes.background: We ask the government to maintain the ban on on all outdoor uses of the neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam. This is proven to be harmful to bees and other wildlife.  We need safeguards to prevent the pollution of run off water containing the chemical at a time when British insects are in serious decline.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2018 Michael Gove, then the environment secretary, said: “The weight of evidence now shows the risks neonicotinoids pose to our environment, particularly to the bees and other pollinators which play such a key part in our £100bn food industry, is greater than previously understood… We cannot afford to put our pollinator populations at risk.”
He also wrote in the Guardian: “Unless the evidence base changes again, the government will keep these restrictions in place after we have left the EU.”

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Retain ban on pesticide neonicotinoid thiamethoxam in the UK, save our bees!
attributes.background:
Bees are essential to the world’s ecosystems. We need bees to fertilise many of our crops. However, they are under pressure around the world from habitat loss and pesticide use. 

A pesticide believed to kill bees has been authorised for use in England despite an EU-wide ban two years ago.
attributes.additional_details:
When the UK promised to back the ban, Michael Gove, then the environment secretary, said: “The weight of evidence now shows the risks neonicotinoids pose to our environment, particularly to the bees and other pollinators which play such a key part in our £100bn food industry, is greater than previously understood...Unless the evidence base changes again, the government will keep these restrictions in place after we have left the EU.”

The evidence base has not changed, retain the ban.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Revoke the decision to give development consent to Hornsea Project Three
attributes.background: We would like the government to reconsider consent for this new wind farm, re-evaluate it's necessity, and reassess the costs and benefits of this venture with a thought for the local environment.
attributes.additional_details:
On Thursday 31st December 2020, the application for Hornsea Project Three Offshore Wind Farm was given development consent - a potentially disastrous decision for local wildlife. The Flamborough coast hosts the largest seabird colony in the UK, with rare seabirds including Gannets, Kittiwakes and Puffins nesting there each year. 

Although the company plan to build nesting towers to reduce the negative impact on the birds, the RSPB have commented that it will take a decade to see whether this works, and it is likely to be too late by then. With the birds being forced to dodge turbines in order to reach feeding grounds, the Hornsea Wind Farm could severely deplete numbers of seabirds in the area, disrupting the local ecosystem even further.

attributes.action: Allow indoor exercise classes in tier 3
attributes.background: Indoor exercises classes to be allowed to continue in tier 3 areas, in a covid safe environment

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555618

attributes.action: Stop work on HS2 immediately and hold a new vote to repeal the legislation
attributes.background: We ask Parliament to repeal the High Speed Rail Bills, 2016 and 2019, as MPs voted on misleading environmental, financial and timetable information provided by the Dept. of Transport and HS2 Ltd. It fails to address the conditions of the Paris Accord as costs have risen from £56bn to over £100bn.
attributes.additional_details: Our environment and economy are in peril. HS2 is destroying nature and inflicting suffering on businesses and property owners. Government is investing in an inept and recklessly run project, offering poor value for money. HS2 will not reach Net Zero by 2050 nor help us level up the North. The pandemic has changed how we work forever and invalidated the business case. Given the climate emergencies we face, and now the economic and pandemic crises - Parliament must vote to repeal the legislation.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314520

attributes.action: Ban fireworks for the environment and those with PTSD.
attributes.background: To ban fireworks in the uk for the environment and those with PTSD, as it can effect animals and people who have horrible trauma in their pasts.
attributes.additional_details: I speak for thousands when I say that it would be a big relief if fireworks were banned as it would make the country better with so many benefits.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: LEGALLY BAN ALL FIREWORKS
attributes.background: Legally ban all fireworks sales and displays in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: There is no NEED for firework displays anymore. I feel we have honestly progressed so much that we should be smart enough to know they are bad PTSD sufferers, extremely bad and dangerous for animals and the environment. I have anxiety and cannot stand fireworks - they are terrifying. They kill animals and greenery every single year. If the government wants to show that it’s doing something to help the environment - banning fireworks is a good start.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: Keep grassroots football training going throughout the current lockdown.
attributes.background: Enable grassroots football training to keep going in an already COVID secure way, within lockdown commencing on 05/11/20
attributes.additional_details: Please for the health, mentally and socially keep grassroots football training on during the lockdown with the current COVID secure measures in place. Children made to be at school within a classroom indoors of 30+ each day. At football training children are in smaller groups & outdoors. They need to keep some normality in their lives. Let them have fun in a secure environment, keeping safe. Do not punish them anymore with taking this freedom away if it’s done in a safe and secure environment.

rejection.details:

Allow outdoor amateur football to continue during lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557467

attributes.action: Stop lock down of the beauty industry
attributes.background: I believe that all salons should be able to stay open we have spent thousands on PPE to follow guidelines over the past months, we have taken the biggest hit already financially over the past 6 months and now will again, we are detrimental to people’s well being & mental health.
attributes.additional_details: STOP LOCKDOWN OFF THE BEAUTY INDUSTRY let our shops stay open, We have bent over backwards to comply to the rules enforced, we have been hit one of the hardest already, we work in clean sterilised environments with PPE there is no indication that we are a cause to any kind of spread, we need our lives & livelihoods back, we need to feed our family’s. We also need to take care of our clients who most of us play a huge role in there mental well-being. We are underestimated & WE ARE ESSENTIAL

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep the beauty industry open: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554478

attributes.action: Omit leisure centres & gyms from the month-long lockdown (5th Nov - 2nd Dec).
attributes.background: Allow swimming pools, leisure centres & gyms to remain open in spite of the most recent lockdown announcement (31.10.20) on the basis that these are well managed environments where the risk of transmission is low & a 2nd period of closure will push many facilities into permanent closure.
attributes.additional_details:
The case has been consistently made that aquatic & physical indoor activity is both safe & a lifeline for many people in such uncertain times & that leisure centres should therefore be considered an essential service.
There are fewer options available to exercise outdoors through the cold winter months than there were during the first, summer, lockdown.
Research published by ukactive shows there had been only 78 confirmed cases among >22 million visits between 25 July and 13 September.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons

attributes.action: Trigger A General Election
attributes.background: The public have lost faith in the government and their shambolic attempts at stopping COVID-19 and action must be taken to end conservative leadership so that a new government take control, and stop the spread of COVID-19 and give support to individuals and local councils with proper funding.
attributes.additional_details: The public do not need to suffer any more under a conservative government, we the public deserve a government who will clearly outline policies, and save lives. We cannot suffer a further 4 years under conservative rule. The government are meant to provide the public with a environment for the public to live life to the fullest and they have failed. We must change leadership and save lives.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314151

attributes.action: Review the A-level grades issued 2020
attributes.background: Review the grades issued to 2020 A-level students as 39% of students have unfairly been downgraded. They have not been able to prove themselves in exams, the students have been under huge amounts of pressure due to Covid-19 and the last thing they need is for their future to be effected by algorithm
attributes.additional_details: Manually review issued grades or allow students to have time to study in a legitimate study environment where they can then take their exams and hopefully achieve grades more accurate to their ability. The lack of teaching they have received due to Covid-19 as well as the other associated struggles should not be held against them, especially as marks awarded are significantly different to predicted grades. Students who worked significantly harder since mock exams have not been given opportunity.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

attributes.action: It should be legislation for employees to have the CHOICE to work from home
attributes.background: I would like for Government or parliament to pass legislation, making it legal for employees (where applicable, especially that of an office environment) To have a choice whether they work from home or not, dis allowing / making it illegal for employers to penalise or dismiss  those that wish to
attributes.additional_details: Giving people this flexibility will not only boost employment figures , it will also help the economy to become stable more quickly. It will also help working parents , with childcare issues (a group being amongst one of those hit the hardest when lockdown was introduced) studies have shown that employees working from home, are much more productive,compared to those working within the office. Working at home reduces the infection rate of the current virus along with any future virus’

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: Allow tattoo studios to open in the 4th July!
attributes.background: Allow us to open, many of us have done risk assessments and have altered our studios to allow for safe working.  We realise we may have to work using ppe, could environmental health visit before we open? We work in a more sterile environment than most Drs surgeries let alone shops and restaurants
attributes.additional_details:
Have a bit more of a knowledge of our industry and how Covid safe we can work.  

Maybe studios that have passed the tattoo hygiene rating scheme.

The virus is not blood borne, most of our clients can be asked to wear ppe/turn away from us/work at the required distance, we disinfect the area to be worked on and many studios are fully disposable

attributes.action: Give Year 12 students the option to retake the Year
attributes.background: We are asking that the Department for Education make provisions for the current Year 12 students to be able to retake the academic year at school if they see fit, as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic
attributes.additional_details: Many, many students, including myself, feel as if they have had a whole years worth of learning wasted as the current crisis has taken away time that was meant to be spent consolidating learning and preparing for exams. Year 12's across the country feel lost, as we are being given unequal learning opportunities, in unequal learning environments, with little to no guidance from government. Giving students the option to retake the year would hand some students the fresh chance they need to succeed

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to show country of origin in product description on internet.
attributes.background: When buying products on the internet the country of origin is rarely stated, to enable the public to make an educated and ethical purchase, country of origin should be clearly declared in the first three lines of the product description.
attributes.additional_details: The fastest route to economic recovery is to support indigenous industry and businesses where possible. Almost every product which is sold on the internet fails to state country of manufacture, so those people who wish to support the country, want to limit their impact on the environment and wish to uphold ethical standards are unable to do so. By simply making it mandatory to state country of origin in the main body of the product description, the public can make informed purchases.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317819

attributes.action: Add businesses such as mechanical industries to the essential closures list
attributes.background: Add factories, warehouses and private businesses that build mechanical equipment, in areas such as agriculture and boating for example, to the "essential closures" list. These industries need to know they can claim financial help if needed and protect their workforce from contamination of Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details:
The businesses that work in areas such as, agricultural equipment, sailing and other mechanical industries are having to put their workers at risk, due to not being on the essential closures list. This is also due to uncertainty about their entitlement to support, from the government. 
Many of these workers are at risk of contracting Covid-19 due to their working environment and often work in confined spaces. For their safety and financial security, please support them and add to the list.

attributes.action: Postpone education for third year students till further notice
attributes.background: Postponing studies will support those who rely on the direct learning and experiences of the practical environments, such as dentistry and medical students.There are thousands of students disadvantaged by the closure of universities and its facilities, especially who do not have access to computers
attributes.additional_details:
It is not fair for these final stages of education to be delivered only through online and virtual learning. This will continue to disadvantage thousands of students from obtaining their desired degree and progressing onto the next stages of their careers.

This will help students in isolation as they will be able to focus more on achieving the grades they deserve at a later date with the right facilities and support that physical university environments provide.

rejection.details:
Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, and decisions about university admissions are a matter for individual universities and UCAS, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to close all universities down for an appropriate amount of time amidst COVID-19, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300628

If you have concerns about admissions you should raise these with UCAS, and if you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

attributes.action: Legalise human composting in the UK and make this eco-friendly option available
attributes.background: To give bereaved families an eco-friendly end of life alternative to burial or cremation. The human composting process is a natural process which avoids the use of any chemicals or fuels and results in rich, fertile soil being returned to the family.
attributes.additional_details: Burial and cremation are currently the only funeral options available to bereaved families in the UK. Both of these options are extremely harmful to the environment. Over 75% of families opt for a cremation which is approximately 470,000 cremations a year. Each cremation produces on average 250kgs of carbon dioxide which is released into the atmosphere (that's 115,000 tonnes a year) Burial also has its own list of harmful factors. One being the absorption of harmful chemicals into earth.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/624352

attributes.action: Ban Fireworks altogether (except organised displays)
attributes.background: Ban Fireworks from being sold to the public, Fireworks should only be for organised displays
attributes.additional_details:
The reason being is that:
1. Its really bad for the environment
2. It terrifies pets (Dogs, Cats, etc)
3. They are very dangerous
4. It scares young childern
So please can you restrict fireworks to organised displays only.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616868

attributes.action: Resolve the energy crisis through Green energy not by fracking or oil and gas
attributes.background: Resolve the energy crisis by investing in green energy; green energy comes on stream about as quickly as new oil and gas or fracking but doesn't harm the environment. It is also sustainable and lower cost. End the exploration of new oil and gas fields and fracking and back green energy instead.
attributes.additional_details:
Resolving our energy crisis by extracting every last drop of oil, every last whiff of gas, and by fracking will contribute to global warming. Global warming is already causing widespread problems, it would be selfish to contribute further to those.
There is no advantage to turning to oil and gas, for instance offshore wind farms can be built in about the same timescale (and in some cases faster) than new oil and gas. Green energy (on or offshore) will reduce energy prices and help the climate.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Decommission all fossil fuel power stations by 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620604

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

If you'd like the Government to take a specific action different to the above petitions we could accept a new petition about this, but it would need to be clear what specific actions you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Reintroduce grants for PV(Solar) installation on domestic properties.
attributes.background: The only way out of the energy crisis is to move away from dependency on fossil fuels and the only way to do this is to focus, develop and implement renewable energy technologies.The installation of renewable technologies is  too expensive to contemplate. Let's help home owners afford them.
attributes.additional_details:
How will it be paid for?
-there are 1.2million people in this country that earn more than £100,000 a year.  temporarily remove the personal tax allowance on all these people. This raises almost £2.5billion a year in tax. 
- The windfall tax on energy companies can be continued while these profits continue. 

The  PV grants  will...
Enable home owners to afford PV.
Reduce demand on our national grid
Reduce damage to the environment
Increase supply and lower gas prices.
Boost sustainable energy

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund grants for installation of solar panels and battery storage for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613855

Increase subsidies and grants for homeowners to improve their energy ratings: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619507

attributes.action: I would like government to intervene in the sale of disposable  vape products.
attributes.background: I want the government to intervene in the sale o disposable vaping produces making them more responsible  for the disposal and recycling  of there product. I believe  we should compel then to introduce a £1 extra charge on them refundable making them responsible for the recycling of there product.
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should be concerned about this growing marked and it would be prudent to to intervene now to developer the technology  and infrastructure to recycle. Making producers and retailers proud of there contribution  to the environment. Likewise ashamed of there contribution if they dont. I believe to do nothing now will store up problem for the future.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the recycling of used e-cigarettes/vapes, however it's not clear whether you want the Government to place certain requirements on the manufacturers of vapes to recycle their products once they've been used, for manufacturers to increase their prices to pay for the recycling of their products, or something else.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to impose a levy of £1 per packet on the sale of vapes, to fund recycling facilities, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Refugees voices need to be heard . Spread awareness about them !!!
attributes.background: We want the government to talk more about refugees and increase there funding and not only some refugees but refugees from all around the world to help and welcome them in the Uk and make a safe environment for them to live in the Uk .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Petitions need to request a change, such as a different policy or law. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide security and incident protocol in every British school.
attributes.background: I would like the British Government to put in appropriate measures to make British schools more secure and safe for pupils and staff, and have a detailed protocol for all schools in the UK on what to do in the case of a major incident/security breach.
attributes.additional_details: Every day in Britain, a schools security will be undermined. Whether it be a dangerous weapon or drugs being smuggled in to the premises, or an intruder entering a place of learning. Several pupils and staff are also very unaware as to what to do in a major security breach/incident. This is unacceptable, the lack of security and protocol is putting our children at risk. Our children deserve a safe secure environment to learn in, as do the personnel who work in the educational establishment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Schools in England are already required to have plans in place, you can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/school-and-college-security/school-and-college-security

Schools in the rest of the UK are devolved to those areas. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: require schools to install solar panels to keep them environmentally friendly
attributes.background: require schools to have solar panels to make it more green and safe to the environment
attributes.additional_details: to protect and preserve the planet

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599937

attributes.action: Help put more police on the streets before and after school hours
attributes.background: For a safer community we need police or community officers on our street to protect our children before and after school hours to endure safety as there has been multiple attempts to kidnap children within the local community!
attributes.additional_details: To have officers patrol the area to ensure children arrive and leave school in a safe manner to be able to make the community feel safe in our living environments for our children. to enable children to still trust our community to enable them to grow up in a society where they should be allow independence!

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local police operations are a matter for individual police forces, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about policing in your area you should contact your local police force or Police and Crime Commissioner about this.

You can find the police force responsible for your area here: https://www.police.uk/

And you can find your Police and Crime Commissioner here: https://www.apccs.police.uk/find-your-pcc/

attributes.action: HELP TO STOP the Hoo New Routes to Good Growth - Higham Road Phase 1
attributes.background:
We want Medway Council to stop the works at Higham Road -INCREASED traffic for the residential road, INCREASED Pollution, INCREASED noise, LARGE scale works, DANGER to the elderly and the young. All residents who use the road to access the open fields and enjoy the surrounds 
HELP STOP THESE WORKS!
attributes.additional_details: We echo Kelly Tolhurst comments (Member of Parliment) "it is important that we continue to come together as a community to fight proposals that will only damage the fabric and environment of our area and strain our local infrastructure and services" These plans are increasing stress and mental health for all residents. COVID is still present these works must be stopped. Safety and the wellbeing of local residents must be priority, these plans are not safe for any residents or pedestrians!

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Increase salaries for EYFS practitioners in independent and public nurseries
attributes.background: Increase the salaries with at least 2,75% for EYFS practitioners including those working in independent nurseries. The government should urgently consider increasing the wages for the people working in that sector as their role has been crucial during the COVID-19 pandemic
attributes.additional_details: EYFS providers remained open and provided F2F services to everyone including the most vulnerable children and families during the most severe times of the coronavirus outbreak. Even that government labelled EYFS as “low risk” it does not mean “No risk” environment. Staff have worked tirelessly to protect and help their communities, however no praise and acknowledgment had been given to those people who’s role was crucial and had significant impact on the smooth function life amid pandemic.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Government are not responsible for setting salaries in the private/independent sector.
